column4: is it possible to update from 5.10 to 6.04 via apt-get (don't want to download an iso and kill my FS)
I wouldn't recommend that until it is out of testing and into productino
:/ not so easy as from deb stable -> deb testing, ok
however, I don't think comparing debian testing and ubuntu dapper is quite the same

well, I have nothing against beta stage, this machine is not intended for production. And in the end - hey, the software is just repackaged and dealing with unfulfilled deps - I can live with that. Are there any known problems if I change repositories and update?
You can change your sources.list to point to dapper and apt-get dist-upgrade, but hold on because some of the dapper packages are broken...that's why it is beta
if you can live with a broken system, then you can try it
well, I wanted a bit updated software (im used to Gentoo ;) ) and due to the fact that ubuntu freezes the versions, I have a "bad" feeling :D
I am curious, do you just want to get the most "bleeding-edge" software possible?
kinda, but should be a bit stable
I probably shouldn't say this in this channel, but why not try debian unstable (with bts)?

last time i did deb unstable, I landed between updated gnome, but outdated gnome-panel (whereby there was no dep ;) ). And in similar situations for other software, too. So I avoid deb unstable. In contrary to that Gentoo's packages are properly packaged, but I can't install it here because the livecd kernel doesn't have netdrivers for this damn laptop :D
yeah, with debian unstable you run certain risks...however, with a bts (bug tracking system), I have _rarely_ had troubles with unstable
i think a bit changed since sarge release. I think you got me. I'll give it a try this weekend. Thanks for the idea ;)
